alert.note: Alert for Catahoula; Concordia; Franklin; Tensas (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 23 at 2:38PM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of southeast Arkansas, northeast Louisiana and Mississippi, including the following areas and parishes, in southeast Arkansas, Ashley and Chicot. In northeast Louisiana, Catahoula, Concordia, East Carroll, Franklin LA, Madison LA, Morehouse, Richland, Tensas and West Carroll. In Mississippi, Adams, Attala, Bolivar, Claiborne, Copiah, Franklin MS, Hinds, Holmes, Humphreys, Issaquena, Jefferson, Lawrence, Leake, Lincoln, Madison MS, Rankin, Scott, Sharkey, Simpson, Smith, Sunflower, Warren, Washington and Yazoo. * WHEN...Through Wednesday evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Waves of heavy rain will continue to move through the region tonight into Wednesday, resulting in continued saturation of grounds and potential for flash flooding. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
